intro: Richardella trigonosperma, commonly known as the three-seeded burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. The species is noted for its adaptability and resilience in harsh environmental conditions.
